thread.title: CONCERT REVIEW: Lil Baby hosts an epic birthday party
thread.title_full: CONCERT REVIEW: Lil Baby hosts an epic birthday party

author: DeAsia Paige
title: CONCERT REVIEW: Lil Baby hosts an epic birthday party
text:
Earlier this year, when Lil Baby announced his first multi-city tour as a solo headliner, fans were stunned that there werenâ€™t any Atlanta dates. In fact, before the â€œItâ€™s Only Usâ€ tour began, the Oakland City native quietly canceled 10 dates and dropped Kid LaRoi as an opening act â€” leading some to speculate about low ticket sales. The canceled dates even led to debates online about whether he can carry his own tour.
Sure, heâ€™s one of the top-selling rappers, but is he a good performer?
At his third annual Lil Baby & Friends Birthday Celebration, the answer was undoubtedly yes. Wednesday nightâ€™s show at State Farm Arena proved that he no only has the captivating stage presence, but he has the love from friends and industry peers to help him along the way. For the rapper, who was born on Dec. 3, the concert was the epitome of a grand birthday party thatâ€™d make anyone envious if they werenâ€™t invited.
It must be said that the concert had a 7 p.m. start time and Lil Baby didnâ€™t appear on stage until a few minutes before 10 p.m. (Memphis rapper Gloss Up, one of the supporting acts for the â€œItâ€™s Only Usâ€ tour, opened the show around 8 p.m. with a 30-minute set that slightly alleviated the long wait). The wait was so perplexing that some fans even wondered if any of his friends would show up at all.
Lil baby and his friends must fell out??
â€” a pisces gworlll ğŸ’–ğŸ’˜ğŸ’•âœ¨ğŸŒ‘ (@lolyesimlying) December 28, 2023 But all the doubt subsided as soon as Lil Baby graced the stage. Suddenly, the long wait didnâ€™t seem to matter anymore as the sold-out crowd rapped along to opening tracks like â€œStand on It,â€ â€œMy Dawgâ€ and â€œSouthside.â€ Wearing a red leather jacket and pants to match, he seamlessly embodied the persona of a rap superstar whoâ€™ll always be adored in Atlanta. And that adoration is reciprocal. The concert felt like a love letter to the Atlanta fans whoâ€™ve made Lil Baby one of the biggest rappers in the world.
Explore PHOTOS: Lil Baby draws star power for birthday bash Last yearâ€™s Lil Baby & Friends Birthday Celebration featured appearances from Drake, Lil Yachty and more. This yearâ€™s show carried the same level of star power. Rappers like Quavo, Rob49, Hunxho, 2 Chainz and Rylo Rodriguez â€” who was met with fans rapping every word to his hit â€œEqual Dirtâ€â€” took the stage earlier in the show. In between those sets, Lil Baby continued the momentum by performing songs like â€œPure Cocaineâ€ and â€œSum 2 Prove.â€
Credit: Robb Cohen for the Atlanta Journ
Credit: Robb Cohen for the Atlanta Journ
And if that wasnâ€™t enough, R&B crooner Fridayy, Detroit rappers 42 Dugg and Veeze, 21 Savage and Lil Durk (who performed DJ Khaledâ€™s â€œEvery Chance I Getâ€ with Lil Baby) also hit the stage. The highlight of the night arrived when J. Cole performed hits like â€œMiddle Childâ€ and â€œNo Role Modelz.â€
The show ended with final appearances from the City Girlsâ€™ Yung Miami and Atlanta singer Jacquees. Dressed in all-black this time, Lil Baby concluded the night with his hit â€œFreestyle.â€ But he didnâ€™t even need to perform the song. The crowd performed it for him, rapping each verse with the fervor of knowing that the hit is indeed an anthemic track for Atlanta hip-hop.
Lil Baby is Atlanta rapâ€™s star of the moment. With three no. 1 albums (his latest, â€œItâ€™s Only Me,â€ was released in 2022) and more than a dozen top 10 hits under his belt, the 29-year-old rapper has become a household name in less than five years. Wednesday nightâ€™s show was a stunning celebration full of surprises that proved the secret to Lil Babyâ€™s skyrocketing success is his unyielding fanbase.

DeAsia Paige DeAsia is an award-winning music and culture journalist whose work has been featured in Pitchfork, NPR Music, Teen Vogue and more. She focuses on the intersection of arts, culture, and diverse communities, as well as how emerging social trends are being expressed through the lens of the Atlanta aesthetic.
